name: Aid Reversal
title: Negative Aid Flow from France and Netherlands
description: In 2022, Indonesia experienced a net negative bilateral aid flow from France and the Netherlands, amounting to -$123.67 million and -$4.8 million, respectively.

name: Carbon Challenge
title: High CO2 Emissions from Land Use
description: Indonesia's carbon dioxide emissions from land use and land-use change reached 924.85 Mt CO2e in 2022, highlighting significant environmental challenges.

name: Price Stability
title: Stable Wholesale Price Index
description: In 2018, Indonesia maintained a stable wholesale price index at 96.49, indicating a relatively stable pricing environment.

name: Investment Surge
title: High Net Investment in Nonfinancial Assets
description: Indonesia's net investment in nonfinancial assets reached 153.63 trillion LCU in 2016, showcasing robust investment activities.

name: Efficient Utilities
title: Top Operational Efficiency in Utility Services
description: By 2024, Indonesia achieved a high operational efficiency score of 98.96 in utility service provision, reflecting effective management.

name: Capital Formation
title: Strong Gross Fixed Capital Formation
description: In 2023, Indonesia's gross fixed capital formation was a substantial 3,848.72 trillion LCU, indicating strong economic growth potential.

name: Manufacturing Might
title: High Manufacturing Value Added
description: Indonesia's manufacturing sector contributed 2,507.80 trillion LCU in value added in 2023, underscoring its industrial strength.

name: GDP Discrepancy
title: Significant GDP Expenditure Discrepancy
description: In 2023, Indonesia faced a GDP expenditure discrepancy of 274.01 trillion LCU, indicating potential inefficiencies in economic reporting.

name: Savings Power
title: High Gross Savings
description: Indonesia's gross savings reached 7,510.60 trillion LCU in 2023, reflecting strong financial reserves.

name: Income Outflow
title: Negative Net Primary Income
description: In 2023, Indonesia experienced a net primary income outflow of -537.94 trillion LCU, indicating more income leaving the country than entering.

name: Education Gap
title: Low Percentage of Trained Preprimary Teachers
description: In 2023, only 3.22% of preprimary teachers in Indonesia were trained, highlighting a significant gap in early childhood education quality.

name: Health Alert
title: Low Antimalarial Treatment for Children
description: In 2017, only 0.2% of children under age 5 with fever received antimalarial drugs, indicating a gap in healthcare provision.

name: Smoking Concern
title: High Tobacco Use Among Males
description: In 2022, 73.1% of male adults in Indonesia were current tobacco users, posing significant public health challenges.
